Articles.Content: I purchased KSP in June of 2013 so I'm apparently not eligible to get Making History for free. Why do those seven weeks make such a big difference? Why April and not March or July?

They had to pick a date. There is no objective reasoning why its a specific date or not. Lets say they did it until June 2013 then the person who bought it in August would say the same thing. Do you feel that you paid to much or that the DLC is to expensive?

For my part: bought it 8/2013 so I had to pay and even though I complain a lot about the mission builder I'd buy the DLC again this istant without the feeling of regret.

Edited March 19, 2018 by Hurzelgnurk

Well, it's probably more like, they wanted to give it for free to early adopters, so the cutoff is really the end of 2012, but then they added 4 months of leniency.

13 hours ago, leptoon said:

Why April and not March or July?

The original announcement from SQUAD after the absurd hissy fit that resulted in free DLC is at http://kerbaldevteam.tumblr.com/post/47730955705/expansions-dlc-and-the-future-of-ksp . Note this bit:

Quote

Also, for those considering purchasing the game, we will maintain this promise for all purchases made until the end of this month (April, 2013).

So, end of April 2013 was chosen as the cutoff because that's when they announced it. Nothing more, nothing less.
The DLC is literally the price of two trips to McDonalds. If I was Take Two I wouldn't have offered it free to anyone. Ever see Bethesda, Frontier or EA offer major DLC's for free?
